required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Long-term Safety and Efficacy Study of Adalimumab in Pediatric Subjects With Ulcerative Colitis
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-Center, Open-Label Study of the Human Anti-TNF Monoclonal Antibody Adalimumab to Evaluate Long-Term Safety and Tolerability of Repeated Administration of Adalimumab in Pediatric Subjects With Ulcerative Colitis Who Completed the Study M11-290

brief_summary.textblock: This study assesses the long-term safety and efficacy of adalimumab in pediatric subjects with ulcerative colitis.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects who achieve clinical remission as measured by PMS
primary_outcome.description: Clinical remission is defined as a PMS less than or equal to 2 and no individual sub score greater 1

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects who achieve PUCAI response
primary_outcome.description: PUCAI response is defined as a decrease in PUCAI greater than or equal to Up to 20 points from Study M11-290 Baseline

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects who achieve clinical response as measured by Partial Mayo Score (PMS)
primary_outcome.description: Clinical response is defined as a decrease in PMS equal to or greater than 2 points and equal to or greater than 30% from Study M11-290 Baseline

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects who achieve Pediatric Ulcerative Colitis Activity Index (PUCAI) remission
primary_outcome.description: PUCAI remission is defined as a score less than 10.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessing impact on children who have inflammatory bowel disease (ulcerative colitis) using IMPACT III questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: This is a 35 item, self-administered questionnaire, with total score ranging from 35 (poor) to 175 (best). The questions are about the quality of the child's life with inflammatory bowel disease.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessing activity impairment using the Work Productivity and Activity Impairment Questionnaire: Ulcerative Colitis (WPAI: UC)
secondary_outcome.description: Measures the impact of your child's UC on the parent/guardian's ability to work and perform regular activities.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects who achieve remission/response based on Full Mayo score
secondary_outcome.description: Full Mayo score will be based on subjects with available Full Mayo score data. Full Mayo score is a composite of 4 subscores. Each subscore is a number from 0 (lowest) to 3 (highest) with a total score of 0-12. Clinical remission per Full Mayo Score is defined as a Full Mayo Score less than or equal to 2 and no individual subscore greater than 1. Clinical response per Full Mayo Score defined as a decrease in Full Mayo Score greater than or equal to 3 points and greater than or equal to 3 points 30% from Baseline.

other_outcome.description: Mucosal Healing is defined as an endoscopy subscore of either 0 or 1.

arm_group.description: Subjects receiving Adalimumab up to 288 weeks

intervention.description: every other week or weekly subcutaneous injection

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subject must have successfully enrolled and completed M11-290 study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subject considered by the investigator, for any reason, to be an unsuitable candidate

facility.name: National Center for Child Health and Development /ID# 147312

link.description: This Clinical Study may be evaluating a usage that is not currently FDA-approved. Please see US prescribing information for approved uses.

patient_data.ipd_description: AbbVie is committed to responsible data sharing regarding the clinical trials we sponsor. This includes access to anonymized, individual and trial-level data (analysis data sets), as well as other information (e.g., protocols and clinical study reports), as long as the trials are not part of an ongoing or planned regulatory submission. This includes requests for clinical trial data for unlicensed products and indications.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data requests can be submitted at any time and the data will be accessible for 12 months, with possible extensions considered.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Access to this clinical trial data can be requested by any qualified researchers who engage in rigorous, independent scientific research, and will be provided following review and approval of a research proposal and Statistical Analysis Plan (SAP) and execution of a Data Sharing Agreement (DSA). For more information on the process, or to submit a request, visit the following link.
